wordpressWpcContributors.bio: Joe is a developer on the team at CampusPress and WPMU DEV, with a focus on front-end development, accessibility and the Upfront theme project. He is a proud dad, husband and casual saxophonist from Rochester, New York.

author.bio: Ronnie leads the team behind the CampusPress, Edublogs, and WPMU DEV Hosting services, which power thousands of WordPress sites for higher ed institutions small and large. A former educator, wannabe musician and math nerd, Ronnie is a Longhorn football-obsessed resident of Austin, Texas.

Joe is a developer on the team at CampusPress and WPMU DEV, with a focus on front-end development, accessibility and the Upfront theme project. He is a proud dad, husband and casual saxophonist from Rochester, New York.

content.raw: Let's take a look at what makes a quality theme or plug-in. We'll share the guidelines that we follow and the automated tools that we use to evaluate plug-ins and themes for performance, reliability, accessibility and security. We'll perform a shortened live review of a popular theme to illustrate the process.

node.title: Code reviews: People use it, so it must be fine
